TEXT.English: [TAB]Storytelling is central to the preservation of Dene culture, and to ensuring that the people preserve their traditions while learning from past mistakes. Almost any extended speech act in Dene is classified as a wodih. Wodih are used to influence an audience by establshing a common base of belief, by sharing the experiences of others, and by suggesting what will happen in the future. All traditional stories are called "tonht' onh wodihe" - "stories of long ago."
